events.message: The claimant reported a car collision that occurred on a busy highway involving their vehicle and another driver.
After review, the claim was categorised as an auto accident related to vehicle collision and property damage.
An agent was assigned promptly to manage the case and communicate with the policyholder about the next steps.
Acknowledgment was sent to the claimant confirming receipt of the auto accident claim and outlining the upcoming process.
The claimant was requested to submit a police report, photos of the car damage, and repair estimates for further assessment.
The claimant provided all requested documents including the official police report and multiple photos showing the vehicle damage.
The investigation team began reviewing submitted evidence and contacting witnesses to determine fault and claim validity.
Investigation concluded confirming the claimant was not at fault, with clear documentation supporting the vehicle collision details.
The insurer proposed a settlement amount based on repair costs and policy coverage, communicated clearly to the customer.
The customer responded positively to the settlement offer, expressing appreciation for clear communication and prompt handling.
Final approval was granted for the claim and the agreed settlement amount was authorized for payment processing.
The payment for the approved claim was issued to the policyholder’s bank account without delay.
The claim was formally closed after successful resolution and payment issuance with no further action required.
All claim documentation and correspondence were archived securely in compliance with the company’s record retention policies.
